conclusion: Understanding the relationship between the light source, the objects, and the shadows they cast.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage with the light source positioned to the left, creating a shadow extending to the right.
Shadow B is cast by the broken glass with the light source positioned to the right, creating a shadow extending to the left.
Shadow C is cast by the chicken leg with the light source positioned to the left, creating a shadow extending to the right.
If the light source moves to the right, it will affect the direction and length of the shadows.
Shadow A will shift to the left and become shorter as the light source moves to the right.
Shadow B will shift to the right and become longer as the light source moves to the right.
Shadow C will shift to the left and become shorter as the light source moves to the right.
Final answer: Shadow A will move to the left and become shorter, Shadow B will move to the right and become longer, Shadow C will move to the left and become shorter.
